items.summary: Celebrate six years of innovation! Discover how educators enhance robotics lessons with SPIKE Prime, 3D printing, and laser cutters, showing that imagination is the limit.
Engage your young students with SPIKE Essential. Build iconic starfighters and let them compete in a cosmic battle, fostering curiosity in coding and robotics for kids aged 6–9.
Explore the dual benefits of 3D printing for SPIKE Prime robotics courses. Creative freedom meets logistical challenges—are you ready to unlock endless possibilities?

Revive the classics with SPIKE Prime! Students create their own Snake and Arkanoid games, learning Python and game mechanics, just like educators who started their tech journey with these iconic games.
Build a moving owl model using SPIKE Prime or mBot 2 and a laser cutter. A project that teaches crank mechanics and design skills, moving education to new heights.
Witness physics in action with the Carousel model using SPIKE Prime or mBot 2. Teach centrifugal force and physics concepts through hands-on experiences and precise construction.
Discover 8 new robotic lesson projects, from cranes to carousels, using SPIKE Prime, mBot 2, and a laser cutter to create engaging and educational experiences for students.
Inspire students by creating cranes, carousels, and more, with SPIKE Prime, mBot 2, and laser cutters. Unique lessons bring innovative, engaging experiences to your class.
Measure wind strength with SPIKE Prime and a 3D-printed anemometer. Use Tinkercad for design and programming lessons that merge real-world data collection and STEM education.
Visualize centrifugal force with the Carousel project using SPIKE Prime and mBot 2. Engage students with hands-on learning and precise laser-cut constructions.
Relive the nostalgia of Snake and Arkanoid by coding them in Python with SPIKE Prime kits. Unleash creativity in students as they build and code these classic games from scratch.
Engage young students in a Cosmic Battle with SPIKE Essential. Build starfighters and let imagination run wild in this fun introduction to coding and robotics for kids.
Build a moving owl using SPIKE Prime or mBot 2 and laser cutters. This project illustrates mechanics and design skills, offering a practical lesson in motion.
